sentences.english: They said, 'We are sorry, the Imperial Japanese army invaded China.
sentences.chinese: 他们说，很对不起，日本皇军侵略了中国。

sentences.english: 1941 - Hong Kong falls to the Japanese Imperial Army.
sentences.chinese: 1941年的今天，香港沦陷日本皇军。

sentences.english: Ono with Mr Mother attend imperial RuChengShi threat the life of gold.
sentences.chinese: 小野用金戈的性命威胁金母参加皇军的入城式。

sentences.english: Both of my grandfathers served as young man in the imperial army.
sentences.chinese: 我的两个爷爷都是皇军中的士兵。

sentences.english: They were known as "comfort women" for soldiers in Japan's Imperial Army.
sentences.chinese: 她们被称为“慰安妇”，为日本皇军“服务”。

definition: Japanese devil (common term of abuse in wartime China and in subsequent writing)
devils/refers to 日本鬼子, wartime term insult for Japanese
phonetic transcription of China (Japanese: Shina), colonial term, generally considered discriminatory
Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
Great East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere, Japanese wartime slogan for their short-lived Pacific Empire, first enunciated by Prime Minister Prince KONOE Fumimaro 近衛文麿|近卫文麿 in 1938
pinyin: Da4 Dong1 ya4 Gong4 rong2 quan1
